name: Letta
info: A Sinner adept at supporting allies. Letta enters battle with [Guiding Safelight]. [Guiding Safelight]: illuminates a diamond area around her, following the carrier as they move. When Letta carries [Guiding Safelight], she recovers 1 point of energy per second, and this effect does not take effect when the [Guiding Safelight] loses its light.
criminalRecord:
Eastside business tycoon Devonshire family's heiress. An elegant, courteous young lady on the outside, she's in fact the real //Lantern Ghost of Sloane Street// behind the urban legend. Her nighttime activity stirred rumors and caused public panic. Detention is advised.

--

Growing up in a repressive environment, the subject abused her power after her awakening and frequently loitered at night. Though she enjoyed pranking pedestrians, she meant only to give them directions and no harm. With Chief's counseling, her stress has been relieved and her natural character unleashed. She's gradually redirecting her energy to normal social activities and hobbies and no longer poses a threat of stirring up public panic.
mutationAssessment:
+++* Ability Summary
Her special power can only be cast using her lantern embedded with Hypercubes. The lantern's light can reveal an exit path in the fog, albeit only visible to her. While holding the lantern, she can travel through walls and even take a small number of companions with her.

+++* Awakening Signs
The subject was attacked by Mania on a foggy night in Eastside, but the lantern she brought suppressed most of the infection. She awakened as a Sinner and narrowly escaped the Corruptors with her special ability.

+++* Corruption State
Displays mild corruption and normal physical characteristics. Affected by Mania, the subject has lost her ability to sleep, yet it hasn't led to any metabolic disorders or severe mental disabilities.
ecbFlavourText:
"I know it might be dangerous out there tonight with the fog."
"But... I'm not going to give up the only chance! I'm going out there right now!"
interrogation1:
Letta sleepwalks to the gate of the MBCC and is taken into custody without issue or complaint. A short while later, she receives a letter from her parents stating that they were aware she had become a Sinner and so became stricter in order to protect her from the world. They believe that the MBCC will be the safest place for her, and remind her to follow the â€œGrowth Planâ€ for her life that they had laid out for her. Letta tells the Chief that her parentsâ€™ high expectations for her as their heiress caused her to be isolated from the outside world and never allowed to experience things outside home and school. One night, during a Mania attack that distracted the household, she took the opportunity to sneak out. She was attacked by Corruptors and awakened as a Sinner, but managed to escape as her newfound ability led her home safely. After that, she regularly used her ability to leave home, prankish people and leading them out of the fog, creating the urban legend of The Lantern Ghost of Sloane Street. Ultimately, she â€œsleepwalkedâ€ to the Bureay in order to get away from her parentsâ€™ authority for good. Letta tells the Chief that she plans on experiencing all the things she never got to see before, and produces a list of urban legends that she wants to investigate. The Chief, realizing that Letta can easily escape and go on her own if she wants to, tries to prevent that becoming a problem and agrees to accompany Letta on her adventure.

Through this letter, you learned of the existence of the// Growth Plan, //and in the process, you found out the truth about the "Lantern Ghost of Sloane Street". And Letta, who has left home of her own accord, can't wait to embark on an adventure of her own. You had to agree to go with her.
interrogation2:
The Chief and Letta set out to experience the four urban legends on her list. The first one, the field of ever-blooming flowers, is located in a small suburban park. The Chief pays for them to enter, but a gust of wind reveals that the unseasonably blooming flowers are actually made of paper; a staff member confesses that he was spreading the rumor to make money so that he could afford to plant real flowers. The second legend, the steel maze of the roaring monster, appears at night on an industrial rooftop. The roar begins and they pursue its source through the maze. Letta uses her ability to transport them through a locked door and into the factory, where a group of workers accuses them of being industrial spies from another company; they work late at night to avoid being detected by their competition. The Chief escapes by claiming to be an inspector responding to Letta's noise disturbance complaint. Their third legend is the midnight phantom ball, which turns out to be a masquerade hosted by a club that runs supernatural-themed events. With each of their first three investigations having quickly dispelled the myths, the Chief worries that Letta will be disappointed with her adventure. However, she is just as entertained by the reality behind the stories as she was with the legends themselves, and they continue together to the final destination on her list.

After a series of oopsises about fake flowers in the garden, mistakenly entering a factory, and misplace confidence in an ad, you expected Letta to be lost and sad, but she remained enthusiastic, and said she had no regrets about her choice. To bring the adventure to a successful conclusion, you decide to continue to the last location.
interrogation3:
The final adventure on Letta's list is the "eerie castle of doom and mystery". They meet a trio who are part of an outdoor adventure club, and agree to explore the abandoned building together. They look through the entire castle, but find nothing aside from an abandoned residential building. Disappointed, one of the adventurers accidentally drops his candle and sets fire to the building. Letta tries to rescue them by bringing them through the walls, but the revelation that she is a Sinner causes her new friends to recoil in horror. The Chief reproaches them scathingly, reminding them that the choice is between accepting Letta's help and burning to death. They give Letta the choice whether to help them regardless; she is conflicted, but she reluctantly decides to allow them to follow her even despite their prejudice. On their way back to the Bureau, the Chief asks Letta how she feels about her decision to leave home now that she's seen some of the consequences of her independence. Letta admits that her parents are probably right that she doesn't have very good judgement, but she is determined to keep the freedom to make her own choices.

Adventure is supposed to come with all sorts of surprises and scares: narrow hallways can turn into flames, new friends can be vicious... You never know what's going to happen next. But none of this will shake Letta's desire for independence. You hand her the freedom to make independent choices, and she chooses to continue practicing her Growth Plan.
arrestRec1: The subject voluntarily appeared in front of the Bureau one night, in a "sleepwalking state" then, she didn't resist the arrest and was therefore detained smoothly.
arrestRec2: Her parents once tailored a personal //Growth Plan// for her and required her to strictly follow it. The plan was adjusted annually according to her progress in school, but she herself had no say in it. She had repeatedly suggested adding outings to the plan in vain.
arrestRec3: The subject is discontented with her frightening image in the urban legend. She claims to have never harmed any pedestrians in the fog with her power but simply tried a few practical jokes, including but not limited to following them with the lantern, tapping them on the shoulder, and appearing suddenly from the wall, etc.
arrestRec4: The subject owns a self-edited //DisCity Adventure Journal// that records various strange attractions in DisCity gathered from the internet, magazines, and urban legends, accompanied by detailed guides. Field visits have later proven most descriptions to be inaccurate, but she doesn't seem to regret her selection of locations.
servingTerm1: Ever since her detention, //paranormal activities// have begun to be observed in the Bureau. Witnesses claim to be constantly followed by an unidentified bright light during night patrols. Security footage reveals the stalker to be the subject in her "sleepwalking state" and the "unidentified bright light" to be the lantern in her hand, but she claims to have no memories of such behaviors.

[Letta was caught by you sneaking out to play.]

**Letta:** Hmmm... Why am I standing here...?

**Chief:** ......

* **Prompt:** ...The wall of the Bureau has to be thickened by a few centimeters.
 * **Letta:** Don't, don't be like this. I'll definitely bring you along next time we go out!

supervision1:
++* âš  All Grown Up

//You receive a new request.//

**System Notifications:** Letta's parents frequently visit her in the Bureau and they bring homework every time. Of course, Letta shirks every meeting with her ability, so the homework never reaches her.

* **Prompt:** Give Her Space

**System Notifications:** Mr. and Mrs. Devonshire can only leave some daily necessities and go, but the meaning of Letta's behavior is not lost on them.
supervision2:
++* âš  All-Nighter Champion

//Several hyperactive Sinners organize an overnight gaming marathon in the Recreation Area.//

**System Notifications:** Several hyperactive Sinners organize an overnight gaming marathon in the Recreation Area. Letta, who's not exactly a gamer, wins. Because all her opponents give in and fall asleep.

* **Prompt:** Bad Example
supervision3:
++* âš  Do Not Disturb

//Some of Letta's behaviors often confuse you.//

**System Notifications:** Ever since Letta joined the MBCC, she's come to your room to peek at your sleeping face every night with her lantern. She calls that //human observation.//

* **Prompt:** Can we not turn on the light?
supervision4:
++* âš âš  Improvise

//You need a document from the archives.//

**Chief:** ...

**Chief:** You're in trouble.

**System Notifications:** You're in urgent need of some documents from the archives, but having turned all your pockets and drawers inside out, you still can't find the key. Just as you stand gloomily outside the archives' door, Letta skips over with her lantern.

**Letta:** Oh? Chief, what are you doing here at this hour?

* **Prompt:** Ask anyway

**Chief:** Letta, have you by any chance seen the archives' key?

**Letta:** Hmm... No.

**Letta:** You can't find it?

**Chief:** No... I happen to urgently need a document from the archives.

**Chief:** But given the circumstances, there's nothing I can do. I'll submit a request for a new key first thing tomorrow morning.

**Chief:** It's quite late, you should return to your room and stop loitering around.

**System Notifications:** You turn to head back to your office, but Letta tugs at your sleeve. She swings her lantern before your eyes.

**Letta:** Why bother? Don't you see what I've got here?

**Chief:** ...That's against the rules.

**Letta:** The MBCC's got even more rules and systems than my home does. But Chief, don't you think we should learn to be flexible sometimes?

**Letta:** Come on, don't be stubborn. Desperate times, desperate measures.

**Letta:** Hehe, here, Chief, come with me!

**System Notifications:** Letta winks and reaches out a hand to you. You debate for a moment but still take her hand in the end.

**Chief:** ...Alright. Desperate times, desperate measures.

**Chief:** No next time!
supervision5:
++* âš âš  New Try

//Letta and [[[Demolia]]] are huddling together, chatting about something.//

**System Notifications:** While passing by the cafeteria, you see Letta and Demolia huddling together, chatting about something. That's a rather strange combo.

* **Prompt:** Go take a look

**Letta:** What are you doing?

**Demolia:** Packing pickled vegetables. I'm just done sun-drying a batch. Look how fresh they are.

**Letta:** Pickled vegetables...? Is that a kind of veggie?

**Demolia:** Are you saying you've never seen pickled vegetables?!

**Demolia:** Here, try it. It's good stuff!

**Letta:** The color doesn't look normal to me... And the smell too... Is it really edible?

**Letta:** Mmph... So salty...

**Letta:** Tastes strange... But I guess it's... um...

**Letta:** Can I take another bite?

**Demolia:** Sure! You can have this whole jar if you like it!

**System Notifications:** Demolia finally notices you standing on the side.

**Demolia:** Oh? Hey there, Chief. Want some?

**Chief:** No, thanks... I haven't finished the last jar you gave me.
supervision6:
++* âš âš âš  Invitation

//One late night, having finished work, you decide to go to the Outdoor Activity Area for a break.//

**System Notifications:** One late night, having finished work, you come to the Outdoor Activity Area for a break under the artificial starry sky with a cup of hot coffee.
Letta, who's fake-sleepwalking everywhere, tags along.

**Letta:** I'm... so... bored...

**Letta:** Ahhh...

**Chief:** Letta, your acting hasn't improved even a bit.

**Letta:** Hehe, can't fool you this time either. Sigh, maybe I should find a reference book and work on it.

**Chief:** An Actor Prepares?

**Letta:** Wow, that sounds super professional.

**Chief:** That book's actually kinda dull. I don't recommend it.

**Chief:** By the way, I feel like I'm seeing you more these days?

**Letta:** Eh? Do you?

**Chief:** Quit fooling around. Tell me, is there something you want from me?

**Letta:** Nothing escapes you, Chief! Well, it's not that important, I was just wondering if you're free this weekend...

**Chief:** ...You're not asking me to take you out and stroll mindlessly at midnight on my day off, are you?

**Letta:** What do you mean stroll mindlessly? That's called a relaxing night walk!

**Letta:** Night walks are fun! Come with me and see for yourself!

**Letta:** So? Will you consider it?

* **Prompt:** Sorry...
 * **Chief:** I have a mission coming up this weekend. I'm not free.
 * **Letta:** How come you're never free every time I ask you? Bummer...
 * **System Notifications:** Unable to stand her disappointed look, you sigh and give in.
 * **Chief:** ...How about this. When I'm done with my mission, I'll take you to an antique shop that's just recently opened.
 * **Letta:** Hehe, you're the best, Chief!
 * **Letta:** Seems that I've won this time.
 * **System Notifications:** She boops your nose mischievously and skips her way back to her room.

* **Prompt:** It's just not a good time.
 * **Chief:** Loitering on the streets late at night as a Sinner may cause unnecessary misunderstandings or troubles.
 * **Letta:** So loitering during the daytime is fine?
 * **Letta:** Hmm... It'll be much less exciting, but if it's with you, I won't say no.
 * **Chief:** Ugh, hold on...
 * **Letta:** Hehe, you must keep your promise! I've got a list of places I want you to take me to, Chief.
 * **Chief:** I'm not finished yet...
 * **Letta:** What's the coolest place we can go, hmm? The Rust? I hear there are some guys specializing in decontamination over there. Sounds pretty exciting!
 * **Letta:** Paradeisos is intriguing too. I've overheard Mom and Dad whisper about it a few times!
 * **Chief:** Sigh, I should learn to say no to you... Alright, give me your list of places, I'll weed out the bad ones.
 * **Letta:** Yay!
baseVoicelines:
[Obtain the Sinner]
(Yawns) Good... morning... I'm... Letta Devonshire, the link between dream and reality...  Hmm... (Rubs eye) If there are no other questions, I'm gonna sit down...

[Raise to Phase 1]
Hm... Now I can go many more interesting places...

[Raise to Phase 3]
Hehe, I'm not the innocent lady you think I am, dear Chief.

[Level Start]
Deep inside the fog... What will I find in there?

[Win Battles]
Hehe... What a wonderful adventure.

[Lose Battles]
Oh... I feel dizzy... I must get out of this dangerous place now...

[Ultimate Skill]
Shine into... this endless fog!

[Die in Battles]
I want to... go home...

[Greeting]
Hmm... (Stretches her back) I hope you'll have... an amazing day... Hehe...

[Conversation 1]
Sorry, I sleepwalk a lot... Please wake me up at once if you find me doing anything weird, promise me!

[Conversation 2]
Um... Bedroom... My bedroom... Hmm, yes, found it... (Wakes up) Ah! This, this is your bedroom? Sorry, I hope I didn't disturb you.

[Conversation 3]
What's in these bottles... Vegetables? Huh? Are you sure they're not spoiled? Then why is this color so... Ehh?! Some Sinners survive on this near the end of the month? What... What an interesting food...

[Special Conversation 1]
When can I... become a grown-up? Not controlled by anyone... I can just do whatever I want to do...

[Special Conversation 2]
You've already... found out? That I pretend to sleepwalk? I knew I couldn't fool you... But you've known it for a while, right? Hehe, that makes us partners in crime.

[Special Conversation 3]
When I'm with you, I can feel real, uninhibited freedom and happiness... So, it's decided! You must take me with you on your next adventure in Eastside!

[Full Compliance]
Been here, been there too... Now, where should we explore next? Hehe, no matter where we go, even if it's a place I've already been to, I'm sure I'll have the most exciting experience with you around! ... You've still got work? Hmmm... Alright, I can wait! After all... we've still got the whole night!

[Idle]
I can't eat them all... Hehe...

[Annoyed]
Ow... Ow... Stop making biscuits on me, little kitty...

[Special Attention]
Shh... Care to look for some fun in the foggy DisCity with me tonight?

[Dispatch]
Hmm... See you later. No need to worry about me... I won't get lost.

[Dispatch Complete]
Hehe... As always, it was a fun trip to an interesting place.

[Level Up]
The light has gotten warmer...
nightmareTalent: Can find the way out of the mist and perform exceptionally well under certain special circumstances.

exclusiveCrimebrand.name: Fognight Hideout
exclusiveCrimebrand.description: New exclusive Ultimate [Fognight Hideout]. Letta gathers the enchanted light in the surroundings and restores 20/30/40 Energy. [Fognight Hideout] can only be used twice in every battle.
exclusiveCrimebrand.flavourText:
"I know it might be dangerous out there tonight with the fog."
"But... I'm not going to give up the only chance! I'm going out there right now!"

guide.title: Summary
guide.text:
Team healer and shielder in a big diamond shaped area around her lantern [Guiding Safelight], which can be moved onto other units at the cost of Letta's energy. All her healing is focused on her skill 1, so level that first.

AoE healing tier list: Hamel > Ariel > Letta

crimebrandSets.name: Early Team Buff
crimebrandSets.note: Increase damage dealt by the team within the first 30 seconds of battle. Good for short battles like BFL.

crimebrandSets.name: Team Buff
crimebrandSets.note: Increase team's damage dealt whenever she ults.

shackles.title: Hazy Protection
shackles.description: The [Guiding Safelight] carrier takes 10% less damage.

shackles.title: Energy Overflowing
shackles.description: Letta gains 15 Energy at the start of a battle.

skills.name: "Sleepwalking"
skills.description: Letta gathers energy instead of dealing Normal Attacks. Within [Guiding Safelight]'s illuminating range, all allied units restore (Letta's Attack * 12%) HP per second.

skills.name: Somber Light

upgrade.description:
Shield factor is increased to $0%.
Shield stack limit is increased to $0%.

skills.description:
Letta transfers [Guiding Safelight] to an allied Sinner. Casting this Ultimate doesn't consume Energy and the cooldown time after each release is 6 seconds.

If [Guiding Safelight] is not carried by Letta, Letta loses 2 Energy per second and doesn't restore Energy as time passes. Within its illuminating range, [Guiding Safelight] grants a (Letta's Attack * 15%) Shield to all allied units per second. The Shield caps at 62.5% of each unit's Max HP and lasts throughout the battle.

When Letta's Energy is exhausted, [Guiding Safelight] loses its illuminating effect and is returned to Letta. It can only regain its light once Letta's Energy is fully recharged. Until then, Letta cannot cast this Ultimate.

skills.name: United As One
skills.description: Attack increases by 8%. At the start of the battle, Letta gains 10 Energy.

upgrade.description:
Attack bonus is increased to $0%.
Gains $0 Energy.

skills.name: Mysterious Alley
skills.description: Within its illuminating range, [Guiding Safelight] allows all allied units to receive 10% more healing and 15% more Shield.

upgrade.description:
Healing received efficiency bonus is increased to $0%.
Shield received efficiency bonus is increased to $0%.

compliance: Unlock File: Performance in Serving Term, Attack +4
Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 1, Attack +5, Unlock Mission: Deploy a non-assistance Letta to battle 10 times.
Unlock File: Performance in Serving Term
Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 3, Unlock Mission: Complete Letta's Interrogation.
Unlock File: Performance in Serving Term, Unlock Sticker
Unlock File: Performance in Serving Term, Unlock Voice: Full Compliance, Unlock Sinner Title: Illuminate the Dreamy Night
servingTerm2: The subject often interviews other Sinners on their experiences and strange stories outside the Bureau and notes down the details. She claims she's doing this to enrich her Adventure Journal, and that its content will be expanded to include not only DisCity but Outlands as well.
servingTerm3: Obsessed with rare and cute dolls and decorations, the subject shares a common topic with Sinners with similar interests around her age. However, due to differences in their backgrounds, she sometimes faces challenges when communicating with Syndican Sinners, but they try their best to understand each other.
servingTerm4: The subject often barges into Chief's bedroom while "sleepwalking" at night and proceeds to rest there. Once awake, she explains that she approaches Chief unconsciously because she feels reassured around Chief and that she's not doing it on purpose.

voicelines.Full Compliance - EN: Been here, been there too... Now, where should we explore next?
